On 8/9/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Michael,
>
> You're r=
ight that the JUnit documentation needs to be improved. As a
> volunteer pr=
oject, we're open to contributions.
>
> The following example may serve to =
address the situation you raise:


This example is going to break when you =
refactor your tests.

Test groups have the advantage of decoupling the name=
 of the test methods
from the methods that are actually run, which is why s=
uch information is
better placed in metadata (annotations) than burned into=
 the method names.
